S.FORM: Mihumisang aip, tu hanian masnanava hai namasnava mu tukuna kakanunnan malus Bunun tupa?
Mihomisang aip, to hanian masnanava hai namasnava mo tokona kakanonnan malos Bonon topa?
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的布農語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today I’m going to teach you how to say Bunun food.

S.FORM: Adu ithal kamu masnanava tu halinga ha?
Ado ithal kamo masnanava to halinga ha?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: Masnanava, nisaikin ithal, adu mahtuang muhna tupa?
Masnanava, nisaikin ithal, ado mahtoang mohna topa?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: Nisaikin utazan, adu mahtu pidaingun halinga tupa?
Nisaikin otazan, ado mahto pidaingon halinga topa?
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?
請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.

S.FORM: Muhnang tupa tu musa'n, pimadaingi halinga.
Mohnang topa to mosa'n, pimadaingi halinga.
S.TRANSL: Read it again. Please speak louder.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my eraser.
請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: Adu mahtuas mapasimul zaku ishahaishais ha?
Ado mahtoas mapasimol zako ishahaishais ha?
Panhaincin ta aip isnavan, napasaduta muhnin tu islunghuan.
Panhaincin ta aip isnavan, napasadota mohnin to islonghoan.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這裡，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: Saikin hai is Aziman tu uvaz tupaun saikin tu Talum.
Saikin hai is Aziman to ovaz topaon saikin to Talom.
S.TRANSL: I am Aziman's son, and my name is Talum.

S.FORM: Saikin hai Aziman tu isnanavan tupaun tu Vilian.
Saikin hai Aziman to isnanavan topaon to Vilian.
S.TRANSL: I am a student in Aziman, my name is Vilian.

S.FORM: Inak ngan hai tupaun tu Alang.
Inak ngan hai topaon to Alang.
Inak tama tu ngan hai tupaun tu Talum.
Inak tama to ngan hai topaon to Talom.
Saia hai inaktu tuhasnanaz. Tupaun saia tu Anu.
Saia hai inakto tohasnanaz. Topaon saia to Ano.
S.TRANSL: He is my brother, his name is Anu.

S.FORM: Isaicia ngan hai tupaun tu Alang.
Isaicia ngan hai topaon to Alang.
Saia hai inaktu kaviaz, tupaun saia tu Ali.
Saia hai inakto kaviaz, topaon saia to Ali.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是Ali。
She is my friend, her name is Ali. *[Imoy] Please change the names of women of all races.

S.FORM: Pun masa'n han dusa in saicia hamisan.
Pon masa'n han dosa in saicia hamisan.
Inak tama hai punmaimaunin aip hamisan.
Inak tama hai ponmaimaonin aip hamisan.

S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: Aiza inak dusa tuhas nanaz pingaz, tasa naubapingaz.
Aiza inak dosa tohas nanaz pingaz, tasa naobapingaz.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.
How many people are in your family?
There are four of us in our family.
你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: Adu aiza isu tuhaspingaz a kuzukuzaun?
Ado aiza iso tohaspingaz a kozokozaon?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?

S.FORM: Naian tu dadusz bunun hai adu isutu massituhas masinauba?
Naian to dadosz bonon hai ado isoto massitohas masinaoba?
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?
Yes, we are all very tall.
Does your sister go to school?

S.FORM: Adu mahansiap isu masinauba malas bunun i?
Ado mahansiap iso masinaoba malas bonon i?
S.TRANSL: Do your siblings speak the language?
Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: Adu muskun kasu tama cina mihumis?
Ado moskon kaso tama cina mihomis?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: Ung, muskun saikin tama cina isian lumah mihumis.
Ung, moskon saikin tama cina isian lomah mihomis.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: Adu muskun kasu hudasnanaz sin mas hudaspingaz mihumis?
Ado moskon kaso hodasnanaz sin mas hodaspingaz mihomis?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?
不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn’t live with them.

S.FORM: Muskun saikin tama cina sin tuhasnanaz mihumis.
Moskon saikin tama cina sin tohasnanaz mihomis.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.
Our tribe is in the geographical region.

S.FORM: Nalakua kasu musuhis sia imutu buav?
Nalakoa kaso mosohis sia imoto boav?
S.TRANSL: 你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: Natudip musuhis mais paslunghunin pasnanavan isia maklanganin.
Natodip mosohis mais paslonghonin pasnanavan isia maklanganin.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.
The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: Ni aip makazav niamin maklang madadu masial.
Ni aip makazav niamin maklang madado masial.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: Ni a dihanin lu'uman minsuma'ina bintuhan.
Ni a dihanin lo'oman minsoma'ina bintohan.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: Islunghuna hudan, minsumin amin vali, aidang hanivalval.
Islonghona hodan, minsomin amin vali, aidang hanivalval.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
What's the weather like where you are?
We're going to have a big storm here.
Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.
The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: Hudanan mais sanganin asa kasu nitu sipungul madas talulung.
Hodanan mais sanganin asa kaso nito sipongol madas talolong.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: Kabilva sangnang nahuanan sain mais sanganin.
Kabilva sangnang nahoanan sain mais sanganin.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.
好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: Hudanan bin? Maviasu lutbu tu luvus amini?
Hodanan bin? Maviaso lotbo to lovos amini?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: Hudanana nata ni saikin mainadas talulung.
Hodanana nata ni saikin mainadas talolong.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: Madaing luvluv kalis luvluvan nak bungu madahpa daingaz.
Madaing lovlov kalis lovlovan nak bongo madahpa daingaz.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.
太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.
I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Let's go buy a pen, shall we?
Well, I still have to buy erasers.
Let's go get breakfast, shall we?
No, I've already eaten at home.
I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: Muskun ta maun inak tu muhus.
Moskon ta maon inak to mohos.
S.TRANSL: 那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let's eat my lunch box together!
What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: Maunik isia kaku tu sinpitia tu haising.
Maonik isia kako to sinpitia to haising.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.
What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: Mainadasik muhus muskun kata maun taunghu vali.
Mainadasik mohos moskon kata maon taongho vali.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!
Let's go play basketball, shall we?
Please help me with the broom.

S.FORM: Ung isaiv kudi asikan mas su.
Ung isaiv kodi asikan mas so.
S.TRANSL: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

S.FORM: Kadangazing saikin sida ishahaishais tu kulali i?
Kadangazing saikin sida ishahaishais to kolali i?
S.TRANSL: Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: Ma'asikik laupaku, sia Talum kadangaz su.
Ma'asikik laopako, sia Talom kadangaz so.
S.TRANSL: I'm sweeping the floor and you asked Talum to help you.
The floor is dirty, go clean it.
那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.
等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.
I'm going to see my teacher.
What do you do after school?
I'm going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: Na malkamaz saia mais kanahtungin isnavan?
Na malkamaz saia mais kanahtongin isnavan?

S.TRANSL: May I ask if Ali is home?
She’s at home, please come in.

S.FORM: Uka ilumah mazsu a iskuzakuza i?
Uka ilomah mazso a iskozakoza i?
S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She’s not here, what can I do for you?
Grandpa, this is Abing, please open the door.

S.FORM: Savi, Ali saikin kilimik su nasungkviaz.
Savi, Ali saikin kilimik so nasongkviaz.
S.TRANSL: Savi, I’m Ali, I’ve come to play with you.

S.FORM: Ung, iliskinun ku kasu, kavata muskun palinutu.
Ung, iliskinon ko kaso, kavata moskon palinoto.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: Ai, masiala imu a ucia hudan.
Ai, masiala imo a ocia hodan.

S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: Maipatala in cina aiptu sanavan kavata maun.
Maipatala in cina aipto sanavan kavata maon.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.
盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.
I ate a lot, I’m full.

S.FORM: Na mudanin saikin namuhnangik musihis sadu mas su.
Na modanin saikin namohnangik mosihis sado mas so.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.
Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: Mihumisang amin, masnanava hai namadas mu aip kusian bauv mapasingav mas madadaingaz.
Mihomisang amin, masnanava hai namadas mo aip kosian baov mapasingav mas madadaingaz.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: Ung, masial na makuuni Bunun tu halinga palinutu madadaingaz.
Ung, masial na makooni Bonon to halinga palinoto madadaingaz.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說布農語。
Okay! We’re going to speak Bunun to the seniors.

S.FORM: Hudas minsumain kamin sadu mas su.
Hodas minsomain kamin sado mas so.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: Ua, hansiap ha kamu malus Bunun.
Ua, hansiap ha kamo malos Bonon.
S.TRANSL: 你們會說布農語啊!真是太棒了!

S.FORM: Uninag amin masnanava hai na madasmu kusian maduhtu huma kuzakuza.
Uninag amin masnanava hai na madasmo kosian madohto homa kozakoza.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: Muampuk amin matudailaz asa nitu sipungul madas iskuzakuza.
Moampok amin matodailaz asa nito sipongol madas iskozakoza.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: Ung, masnanava aizanin amin kaimin tu haihaimangsut.
Ung, masnanava aizanin amin kaimin to haihaimangsot.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.
You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: Mihumisang kusian kata padangian madia sinaipuk tu minihumis.
Mihomisang kosian kata padangian madia sinaipok to minihomis.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

S.FORM: O masial, namakua kata kudip i?
O masial, namakoa kata kodip i?
S.TRANSL: 好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?
大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: Antanngaus hai hazam antankinuz hai ivut, kana'ka sadu.
Antanngaos hai hazam antankinoz hai ivot, kana'ka sado.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.
It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: Mais tasa tu tuki hai musuhisin kata muampuk.
Mais tasa to toki hai mosohisin kata moampok.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: Sinaduik madia tu ivut sin mas madia tu hazam.
Sinadoik madia to ivot sin mas madia to hazam.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: Ma'luangtu kauman mamuhu inak a bantas.
Ma'loangto kaoman mamoho inak a bantas.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.
There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: Isngadah haincin danum, haincin kata sunghahaul.
Isngadah haincin danom, haincin kata songhahaol.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.
What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?
How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: Tunsian saia mas ci-iun tu lalisapuz kusia isnanavan.
Tonsian saia mas ci-ion to lalisapoz kosia isnanavan.
S.TRANSL: He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: Makua isu hudaspingaz kudip mabaliv sanglav?
Makoa iso hodaspingaz kodip mabaliv sanglav?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?
She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Orchid Island?
I want to take a boat to Lanyu.
How did he get to Orchid Island?
He took a plane to Orchid Island.
What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

S.FORM: Tunsia saia mataliskang tu lailisapuz kusian Takau.
Tonsia saia mataliskang to lailisapoz kosian Takao.
S.TRANSL: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: Adu tundaza saia lalisapuz kusia Pusun?
Ado tondaza saia lalisapoz kosia Poson?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: Ung, tundaza saia lailisapuz kusian Pusun.
Ung, tondaza saia lailisapoz kosian Poson.
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: Adu tundaza saia lailisapuz kusia Pusun?
Ado tondaza saia lailisapoz kosia Poson?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: Ni tun hikuki saia munsia Pusun.
Ni ton hikoki saia monsia Poson.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.
Is there a bus stop near here?
有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: Isa saincin miskuan papanduan mas ci-iun i?
Isa saincin miskoan papandoan mas ci-ion i?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: Uka saincin papanduan ci-iun, asa kasu tu tudaza takusi.
Uka saincin papandoan ci-ion, asa kaso to todaza takosi.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: Mais tunlaili hai talpia tu zikang tunasia isnanavan?
Mais tonlaili hai talpia to zikang tonasia isnanavan?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: Aida tu masanhan hima tu tuki na susian isnanavan.
Aida to masanhan hima to toki na sosian isnanavan.
Mais tunsian matliskang tu lailisapuz talpia tu zikang tunasia Taicung?
Mais tonsian matliskang to lailisapoz talpia to zikang tonasia Taicong?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?
I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: Adu malbuntu mais ma-unting laili munsia Ulai tu asang?
Ado malbonto mais ma-onting laili monsia Ulai to asang?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?
你搭捷運來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?

S.FORM: Na aida tu mapusan tu punkang.
Na aida to maposan to ponkang.

S.TRANSL: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

S.FORM: Adu mahtuik masingav mas su i?
Ado mahtoik masingav mas so i?

S.TRANSL: Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

S.FORM: Mais minaunin hai aiza inak ailuan, miliskinik tu adu mahtu kusuan mapasinagav?
Mais minaonin hai aiza inak ailoan, miliskinik to ado mahto kosoan mapasinagav?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: Mahtu na ilumahik maltala mas su-u.
Mahto na ilomahik maltala mas so-o.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: Adu aiza su gutunin ailuan asaik masingav su paliuni itu Bunun habasang tu sinihumis.
Ado aiza so gotonin ailoan asaik masingav so palioni ito Bonon habasang to sinihomis.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於布農族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I’d like to ask you about the legendary story of the [Bunun] people.

S.FORM: Kamaninak madia hansaipun haitu na macinanuik tahu inak tu kaihansaipun.
Kamaninak madia hansaipon haito na macinanoik taho inak to kaihansaipon.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但是我會盡量講我所知道的。
I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

S.FORM: Ta'aza-iktu kasu hai mahasiapa mas Bunun tu sinlulus-an asa saikin pishaip mas su-u.
Ta'aza-ikto kaso hai mahasiapa mas Bonon to sinlolos-an asa saikin pishaip mas so-o.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對布農族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you are very familiar with the traditional customs of the Bunun and I would like to ask you a few questions.

S.FORM: Kauman amin hansaipun haitu mais hasaipun ku hai na altalamunuku.
Kaoman amin hansaipon haito mais hasaipon ko hai na altalamonoko.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: Adu mahtuik lahaningu su aupa mais habasin hai na ma-aipi iliskinun.
Ado mahtoik lahaningo so aopa mais habasin hai na ma-aipi iliskinon.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: Na aizin inak pu masivaun han vau tu hamisan.
Na aizin inak po masivaon han vao to hamisan.
Masingavik isutu maluspingaz saia hai Bunun siduh aupa?
Masingavik isoto malospingaz saia hai Bonon sidoh aopa?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是布農族人嗎?
No, she’s from the Paiwan tribe.

S.FORM: Hansiapik malus Bunun sin malus Put.
Hansiapik malos Bonon sin malos Pot.
S.TRANSL: 我會說布農語和閩南語。

S.FORM: Manaskal saikin aip mahtu masingav mas su na pali-unita hahanup sin samu tu hansiap?
Manaskal saikin aip mahto masingav mas so na pali-onita hahanop sin samo to hansiap?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: Ung, habasang tu mainduduazang malulusbut munludun hanup.
Ung, habasang to maindodoazang malolosbot monlodon hanop.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: Mihumisang madia isu aipa sinava, tuza tu masanbut.
Mihomisang madia iso aipa sinava, toza to masanbot.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: Mamantuk inak sintahu itu madadaingaz tu hansiap.
Mamantok inak sintaho ito madadaingaz to hansiap.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: Panaupincia imita sinsingav uninang isutu sintahu.
Panaopincia imita sinsingav oninang isoto sintaho.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That’s all for today’s interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: Namudani saikin na maltala muhnin ta'aza isu tu sintupa tu inihumisan.
Namodani saikin na maltala mohnin ta'aza iso to sintopa to inihomisan.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.
Hello, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a cup.
Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: Asaik mabaliv kupu, aizangmu isbabaliv i?
Asaik mabaliv kopo, aizangmo isbabaliv i?
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?

S.FORM: Aiza, pia su asauan mabaliv i?
Aiza, pia so asaoan mabaliv i?
S.TRANSL: Yes, how many do you want to buy?
No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.
I want to buy two bottles of oil.
We only have one bottle left.
How many pounds do you want to buy?
How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.
I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: Aizang saincin muda tau pisu amin.
Aizang saincin moda tao piso amin.
S.TRANSL: There are three left, all for you!
How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: Muskun hai mapusan han tasa sui, kadazun mapusan sui.
Moskon hai maposan han tasa soi, kadazon maposan soi.
Avandi hai masivaun han hima sui.
Avandi hai masivaon han hima soi.
Mabalivang tu kauman puskunun tasaba sui.
Mabalivang to kaoman poskonon tasaba soi.
S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: Amin hai ima saba tu mas-an sui.
Amin hai ima saba to mas-an soi.
Adu mahtu kadazun hima saba sui?
Ado mahto kadazon hima saba soi?
Mahlis a dian adu mahtu kaumanunang tu kauman.
Mahlis a dian ado mahto kaomanonang to kaoman.
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?
不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.
I want this packet of cookies.

S.FORM: Avan di pinaklang tu kamasia hai maciun sui, adu asangas sida duma tu mazmaz?
Avan di pinaklang to kamasia hai macion soi, ado asangas sida doma to mazmaz?
S.TRANSL: 這餅乾30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

S.FORM: Mahtu aupa saikin simul suan mas sui?
Mahto aopa saikin simol soan mas soi?
S.TRANSL: Can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: Mahtu na pia su sui asaun simulun?
Mahto na pia so soi asaon simolon?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: Sipungulik madas mas sui adu mahtuik simul suan mas sui?
Sipongolik madas mas soi ado mahtoik simol soan mas soi?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring the money, can I borrow money from you?
I don't have any money either!

S.FORM: Sipunglik madas mas sui adu mahtuik suan simul mas sui?
Siponglik madas mas soi ado mahtoik soan simol mas soi?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring the money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: Ni, tangusang tu sinimul hai niang kasu masuhisi.
Ni, tangosang to sinimol hai niang kaso masohisi.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: Adu mahtuik simul isu tu patasan?
Ado mahtoik simol iso to patasan?
Pasimulavang saikin isu tu tauntun laili?
Pasimolavang saikin iso to taonton laili?
S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.FORM: Mahtu, kaz asatu suhaisun mais kutunin.
Mahto, kaz asato sohaison mais kotonin.
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: Hudananin nik mainadas talulung pasimulavik talulung ha?
Hodananin nik mainadas talolong pasimolavik talolong ha?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me one?

S.FORM: Kaznak tasa talulung, muskun ta talulungan.
Kaznak tasa talolong, moskon ta talolongan.
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

S.FORM: Sain hai sinimulku tu tangusang tu patasan sahaisunku su-an.
Sain hai sinimolko to tangosang to patasan sahaisonko so-an.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: Maz su asaun saduan tu patasan mahtu tahu mas zaku i.
Maz so asaon sadoan to patasan mahto taho mas zako i.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.

S.FORM: Lakuinik na masuhis mas suan sui?
Lakoinik na masohis mas soan soi?
S.TRANSL: When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: Nitu makua tudipin mais aizin su sui.
Nito makoa todipin mais aizin so soi.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It's okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: Lakuabinin kasu masuhis mas zaku sui?
Lakoabinin kaso masohis mas zako soi?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to pay me back?
I'll return it to you tomorrow.
When are you going to return my book?
我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: Avandi ispatasan hai sinimulan su sia Vilian?
Avandi ispatasan hai sinimolan so sia Vilian?
S.TRANSL: Did Vilian lend you this pen?

S.FORM: Mamantuk sinimul ku aip tu hanian.
Mamantok sinimol ko aip to hanian.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: Avandi ispatasan hai sinimulan sia Vilian?
Avandi ispatasan hai sinimolan sia Vilian?
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from Vilian?
No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: Ukin na hasila munsaina Abus simul tu kauman.
Ukin na hasila monsaina Abos simol to kaoman.
S.TRANSL: We are out of salt, let's borrow some from Abus.

S.FORM: Tupai a Akuan tu masuhaisa sui.
Topai a Akoan to masohaisa soi.
S.TRANSL: Go tell Akuan to give me my money back.
How much does she owe you?
I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: Masmut salaz mahunik ismut, masul sangnin danum.
Masmot salaz mahonik ismot, masol sangnin danom.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There’s too much grass, I’m cutting it, I’ll have to water it later.

S.FORM: Kadangzavik sida navu sin mas tanga ha?
Kadangzavik sida navo sin mas tanga ha?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?
我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.
你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: Adip tamana hai mahtun isbaliv idaizatu sanglav hai niang mahtu sizaun.
Adip tamana hai mahton isbaliv idaizato sanglav hai niang mahto sizaon.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的高麗菜可以收成了，那裡的昭和草就還不能收成。
The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

S.FORM: Ai, madia su sin kazkaz utanin.
Ai, madia so sin kazkaz otanin.
S.TRANSL: 哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

S.FORM: Kadangdavang mapun sia dainpusan tu lumah tan?
Kadangdavang mapon sia dainposan to lomah tan?
S.TRANSL: Will you help me with the barn?
We’re releasing fishing nets to catch fish.
魚簍裡已經抓了很多魚。
The fish basket has been full of fish.
How do you usually catch fish?

S.FORM: Makusia kaimin busul panga manah iskan.
Makosia kaimin bosol panga manah iskan.
S.TRANSL: I shoot fish with a spear.
Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: Mala'hu kaimin madamu taki-ismut, mintun amin makusia busul madas asu hanup.
Mala'ho kaimin madamo taki-ismot, minton amin makosia bosol madas aso hanop.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.
This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: Avandi hai vanis tu dapan lahahaiban vanis tu dan.
Avandi hai vanis to dapan lahahaiban vanis to dan.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: Kavata sadu sinpala'hu maupin aida cis-a'hu.
Kavata sado sinpala'ho maopin aida cis-a'ho.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.
狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let’s follow them.
你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: Sain hai hatub patushatu mas aluaz.
Sain hai hatob patoshato mas aloaz.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.
你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?
那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: Matumashing madadaingaz madia aip a siniza minihumis.
Matomashing madadaingaz madia aip a siniza minihomis.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: Ung, dasunta musuhis buav muskunta mapisihtu.
Ung, dasonta mosohis boav moskonta mapisihto.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let’s take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: na masnava masnanava aip tu hanian mas itu Bunun tuza paliunis minihumis tu istuangan.
na masnava masnanava aip to hanian mas ito Bonon toza palionis minihomis to istoangan.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的布農語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Bunun language today.

S.FORM: na masnava masnanava aip tu hanian mas itu Bunun tuza paliunis isia dalah cin mintalukai minihumis tu istuangan.
na masnava masnanava aip to hanian mas ito Bonon toza palionis isia dalah cin mintalokai minihomis to istoangan.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的布農語怎麼說。

S.FORM: na masnava masnanava aip tu hanian mas itu Bunun tuza kakaunun tu istuangan.
na masnava masnanava aip to hanian mas ito Bonon toza kakaonon to istoangan.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的布農語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Bunun language today.

S.FORM: adu is Husung saia tu ulus?
ado is Hosong saia to olos?
ni, itu Tahai saia tu pan-apavun.
ni, ito Tahai saia to pan-apavon.

S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.
Share the book with your classmate next to you.
I will lend you my eraser.

S.FORM: islunghuin katan isnavan, mananulua mais kulumah.
islonghoin katan isnavan, mananoloa mais kolomah.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心!
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.
我們要下課了，大家再見。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.
Hello everyone, my name is Ciang.
Hello everyone, my name is Biung.

S.FORM: saikin hai is Dahu tu cina, Palahu saikin.
saikin hai is Daho to cina, Palaho saikin.
is Dahu saikin tu naubapingaz, Abus saikin.
is Daho saikin to naobapingaz, Abos saikin.
S.TRANSL: 我是Dahu的妹妹，我的名字是Abus。
I am Dahu’s sister. My name is Abus.

S.FORM: inak saia tu tuhasnanaz, Husung saia.
inak saia to tohasnanaz, Hosong saia.

S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?
My elder sister’s name is Tanivu.
What is your younger sister’s name?
My younger sister’s name is Anika.
How old is your elder brother?
How old is your younger brother?

S.FORM: adu aizan imu a asang mas pasnanavan?
ado aizan imo a asang mas pasnanavan?
S.TRANSL: Do you have schools in your community?

S.FORM: adu isian kasu asang cia mapasnava?
ado isian kaso asang cia mapasnava?
S.TRANSL: 你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?
是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.
你的媽媽從事什麼工作?
你的爸爸從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: ni, itu naubananaz saia tu kaviaz.
ni, ito naobananaz saia to kaviaz.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.
No, she is my younger sister.
How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: ukan saikis naubananaz, aiza tu tatau naubapingaz.
okan saikis naobananaz, aiza to tatao naobapingaz.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don’t have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: makua aip tu hanian a dihanin?
makoa aip to hanian a dihanin?
makazavkazav aip tu haninan, huhudas pinishaci tu danum.
makazavkazav aip to haninan, hohodas pinishaci to danom.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: makua aip tu hanian a dihanin?
makoa aip to hanian a dihanin?
mabahis aip tu hanian, huhudas danum.
mabahis aip to hanian, hohodas danom.
S.TRANSL: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.
The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.
There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: nani kutunin valian, nalu-uman at namadaing a luvluv.
nani kotonin valian, nalo-oman at namadaing a lovlov.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: namakazav mais tudipin, asa tu mainuk mas pan-apavun.
namakazav mais todipin, asa to mainok mas pan-apavon.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.
How’s the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: namasial tudipin dihanin, nani tu hudanan.
namasial todipin dihanin, nani to hodanan.
S.TRANSL: 那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy that day?
Yes, it will be rainy that day.
The rain stops and the sun comes out.
It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: ni laupaku hudanan, madasas talulung i, nahudanan mais minaunin.
ni laopako hodanan, madasas talolong i, nahodanan mais minaonin.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

S.FORM: adu namakazav mais katavinin tu haminsan?
ado namakazav mais katavinin to haminsan?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: ung, namakazav mais katavinin tu hamisan, asa tu pansupahas ulus mainuk.
ong, namakazav mais katavinin to hamisan, asa to pansopahas olos mainok.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.
Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: ung, namamaklang mais isia talabal, asa tu huhud danum.
ong, namamaklang mais isia talabal, asa to hohod danom.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: mazima saikis namintalabal tu tus'a, aupa mananghat a iviv.
mazima saikis namintalabal to tos'a, aopa mananghat a iviv.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: adu mazima kasu mas naminhamisan tu tus'a?
ado mazima kaso mas naminhamisan to tos'a?
ni saikin mazima mas naminhamihsan tu tus'a, aupa supah a balivus.
ni saikin mazima mas naminhamihsan to tos'a, aopa sopah a balivos.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.
I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.
I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?

S.FORM: ung, adu mahtu saikin simul isu tu ispapatas?
ong, ado mahto saikin simol iso to ispapatas?
S.TRANSL: Yes, can you lend me a pen?
What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?
What did you have for lunch?

S.FORM: ngausin kasu kudi, nakilimun ku kasu sanganin.
ngaosin kaso kodi, nakilimon ko kaso sanganin.
S.TRANSL: 你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.
No, we have to carry books first.
Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.
Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.
What are you going to do after school?
What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: uka Aping lumah cia, Ciang saikin, mabis isu naispalinutu i? natahuan ku Aping mais minsumain.
oka Aping lomah cia, Ciang saikin, mabis iso naispalinoto i? natahoan ko Aping mais minsomain.
S.TRANSL: Aping不在家耶!我是Ciang，有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告Aping。
Aping is not at home. I am Ciang. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: hudaspingaz, kaimin hai Ciang mas Aping! tauav ilavan.
hodaspingaz, kaimin hai Ciang mas Aping! taoav ilavan.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是Ciang 和 Aping，幫我們開門!
Grandma, we are Ciang and Aping, please open the door for us.
I am Ciang, I am here for Umas.
Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: malbuntuin kasu nitu tantungu, malaspu saikin masu.
malbontoin kaso nito tantongo, malaspo saikin maso.
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

S.FORM: Aping minsumainik kilim su namapahainan ta.
Aping minsomainik kilim so namapahainan ta.
S.TRANSL: Aping, I am here to play with you.
Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: tanama maus inak sinsuaz tu utan tan!
tanama maos inak sinsoaz to otan tan!
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看!
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: tuzainin! tanama maus inak sinsuaz tu kakaunun tan.
tozainin! tanama maos inak sinsoaz to kakaonon tan.
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: tuza tu madavus a sinsuaz su kakaununan.
toza to madavos a sinsoaz so kakaononan.
mal-anuhua! tanama maus inka sinsuaz tu iuci acipul tan!
mal-anohoa! tanama maos inka sinsoaz to ioci acipol tan!
S.TRANSL: 請坐! 這是我種的有機玉米吃看看!
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.
Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: ni saikin mahtu maus izuk, namaunik lingku cin.
ni saikin mahto maos izok, namaonik lingko cin.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

S.FORM: masalad saikis kakaunun tan. nakaunun su
masalad saikis kakaonon tan. nakaonon so
S.TRANSL: Let me peel the fruit for you.
Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.
I will bring you some water.
Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.
Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I’ll make myself at home then.

S.FORM: ik-supaha maun i, supahang andi pandianan.
ik-sopaha maon i, sopahang andi pandianan.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

S.FORM: suhaphin kinaunan ku, nin mahtu kuhna maun.
sohaphin kinaonan ko, nin mahto kohna maon.
S.TRANSL: 我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: naadasun ku kamu aip tu hanian kusia ludun.
naadason ko kamo aip to hanian kosia lodon.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: tupa cina tu supah langkitaz sia ludun cia.
topa cina to sopah langkitaz sia lodon cia.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子。
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: na adasus masnanava kamu aip tu hanian ku sia huma.
na adasos masnanava kamo aip to hanian ko sia homa.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

S.FORM: na kusia kata aip tu hanian?
na kosia kata aip to hanian?
na adasun katas masnanava kuvahlas cia.
na adason katas masnanava kovahlas cia.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

S.FORM: na ku isa kata aip tu hanian?
na ko isa kata aip to hanian?
na adasun katas masnanava kusia ludun cia.
na adason katas masnanava kosia lodon cia.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

S.FORM: adu na kuvahlas cia kata aip tu hanian?
ado na kovahlas cia kata aip to hanian?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: ni, na adasun tas masnanava cia kusia ludun.
ni, na adason tas masnanava cia kosia lodon.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

S.FORM: adu na kusianta aip tu hanian sia ludun cia?
ado na kosianta aip to hanian sia lodon cia?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the mountains today?

S.FORM: ni, na kusian ta aip tu hanian sia bangkal cia.
ni, na kosian ta aip to hanian sia bangkal cia.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: masnanava, na maz saduanta sia vahlas cia?
masnanava, na maz sadoanta sia vahlas cia?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: masnanava na maz saduanta sia ludun cia?
masnanava na maz sadoanta sia lodon cia?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.

S.FORM: na mapikua ta sia bangkal cia?
na mapikoa ta sia bangkal cia?
S.TRANSL: We are going to see butterflies.

S.FORM: na ku sian ta bangkal cia sadus imita sinsuaz tu acipul, mananuluai aiza iahlulua mas vanu!
na ko sian ta bangkal cia sados imita sinsoaz to acipol, mananoloai aiza iahloloa mas vano!
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷!
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

S.FORM: masnanava adu na kusianta vahlas cia sunghahaul?
masnanava ado na kosianta vahlas cia songhahaol?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?
No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: masnanava adu na kusianta bangkal masuaz sanglav?
masnanava ado na kosianta bangkal masoaz sanglav?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

S.FORM: na kudita aip tu hanian masuhaz dalah.
na kodita aip to hanian masohaz dalah.
S.TRANSL: We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: sinaduik aip tu hanian mas mamantuk mihumisang tu salinghanuaz.
sinadoik aip to hanian mas mamantok mihomisang to salinghanoaz.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: ie! mazima saikis balikuan aupa manau-uaz.
ie! mazima saikis balikoan aopa manao-oaz.
S.TRANSL: 耶! 哇! 我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: ni saia balikuan saia hai vanu.
ni saia balikoan saia hai vano.
S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: isainacin sadu, kakatu kudahvian cia hai!
isainacin sado, kakato kodahvian cia hai!
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

S.FORM: ung, na ni kaimin ku dahvian.
ong, na ni kaimin ko dahvian.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: kakatu cisdadan mudaukdauk a madadan i na ciskapat.
kakato cisdadan modaokdaok a madadan i na ciskapat.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.

S.FORM: na tun maz kasu kusia taluhan cia?
na ton maz kaso kosia talohan cia?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: na untingik haiia kusia taluhan cia.
na ontingik haiia kosia talohan cia.
na tun maz saia kusia pa-i-iuan cia?
na ton maz saia kosia pa-i-ioan cia?
S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?

S.FORM: na kan bantas saia kusia pa-i-iuan cia.
na kan bantas saia kosia pa-i-ioan cia.
na tun maz kasun kusia Pinghu?
na ton maz kason kosia Pingho?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: na tun kusbabai saikin kusia Pinghu cia.
na ton kosbabai saikin kosia Pingho cia.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.

S.FORM: na tun maz kasu kusia Pinghu cia?
na ton maz kaso kosia Pingho cia?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: na tun hatu saikin kusia Pinghu cia.
na ton hato saikin kosia Pingho cia.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: na tun maz kasu ku lumah?
na ton maz kaso ko lomah?
natun maz a Ciang kusia pasnanavan?
naton maz a Ciang kosia pasnanavan?
S.TRANSL: How does Ciang go to school?

S.FORM: tundaza Ciang mas tunhusulan kusia pasnanavan cia.
tondaza Ciang mas tonhosolan kosia pasnanavan cia.
S.TRANSL: Ciang goes to school by train.

S.FORM: maz tundazas Dahu cia kusia Kiukai?
maz tondazas Daho cia kosia Kiokai?
S.TRANSL: How does Dahu go to church?

S.FORM: tun tampu Dahu a kusia Kiukai.
ton tampo Daho a kosia Kiokai.
S.TRANSL: Dahu goes to church by bicycle.

S.FORM: adu tun dazas ciiun kusia pasnanavan?
ado ton dazas ciion kosia pasnanavan?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: ni, tun basu saikin kusia pasnanavan.
ni, ton baso saikin kosia pasnanavan.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.
Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: ung, tun tampu saikin kusia pasnanavan.
ong, ton tampo saikin kosia pasnanavan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: tun dazas aupas kauti kusia Takau?
ton dazas aopas kaoti kosia Takao?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: ung, tun dazik kauti kusia Takau.
ong, ton dazik kaoti kosia Takao.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: adu tun dazas tunhusulan? adu tunkusbabai kusia Taitu?
ado ton dazas tonhosolan? ado tonkosbabai kosia Taito?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: tun kusbabai saikin, tun kusbabai hai mastas tundazas tunhusulan mabiskav.
ton kosbabai saikin, ton kosbabai hai mastas tondazas tonhosolan mabiskav.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: adu tundazas tamunus, adu kana-anak unting haiia kusia Kiukai?
ado tondazas tamonos, ado kana-anak onting haiia kosia Kiokai?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: kana-anak saikin unting haiia kusia Kiukai, mastan haiia mas tamunus cia madauzung!
kana-anak saikin onting haiia kosia Kiokai, mastan haiia mas tamonos cia madaozong!
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: adu malaisku imu lumah mas babalivan cia?
ado malaisko imo lomah mas babalivan cia?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: maldahvi, tun utubai saikin mais kusia babalivan cia.
maldahvi, ton otobai saikin mais kosia babalivan cia.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: adu malaisku iubiing mas pasnanavan cia?
ado malaisko iobiing mas pasnanavan cia?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: adu malaisku a kakaunan mas tunbasuan cia?
ado malaisko a kakaonan mas tonbasoan cia?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: maisisia tunbasuan cia munapav, mudadan tu ima taiktaik hai taunadipin.
maisisia tonbasoan cia monapav, modadan to ima taiktaik hai taonadipin.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

S.FORM: adu aizanas zikang aip tu hanian?
ado aizanas zikang aip to hanian?

S.TRANSL: I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: kakang minsuma i, talpatazunangik aip tu hanian.
kakang minsoma i, talpatazonangik aip to hanian.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家，改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: adu dangianas kutus islunghuan? nakusuanik minaunin tantungu.
ado dangianas kotos islonghoan? nakosoanik minaonin tantongo.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.
Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: adu mahtu saikin sizas isu tu sing'av? napatasanku.
ado mahto saikin sizas iso to sing'av? napatasanko.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

S.FORM: adu mahtu sizas isu tu haningu?
ado mahto sizas iso to haningo?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: kaka i, ninak paininukanan masial saduan, niang amin sukuan inasik.
kaka i, ninak paininokanan masial sadoan, niang amin sokoan inasik.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.
Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: uninangi, mahtuas tantunguan ku sizas hansiap.
oninangi, mahtoas tantongoan ko sizas hansiap.
S.TRANSL: Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: ni tu makua, namaz su asaun istupa?
ni to makoa, namaz so asaon istopa?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?
請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?
我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: isu uvaz hai adu isia asang amin?
iso ovaz hai ado isia asang amin?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?
不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: saipukangik tu tasa mas asu, tasa hazam, naia hai inak tu aluskunan.
saipokangik to tasa mas aso, tasa hazam, naia hai inak to aloskonan.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: saipukik amis naung tu tasa, mais aiza minihumis aluskunan hai ni tu mahanimulmul.
saipokik amis naong to tasa, mais aiza minihomis aloskonan hai ni to mahanimolmol.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: asa-ik mapatuhu mas ishahanup tu samu.
asa-ik mapatoho mas ishahanop to samo.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: kauman a inak hainiiapan, haitu mahtuik tahus hainiiapan-ku.
kaoman a inak hainiiapan, haito mahtoik tahos hainiiapan-ko.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.
你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: itu bunun tuza ishahanupa haimangsut hai, masamu maluspingaz ciuni.
ito bonon toza ishahanopa haimangsot hai, masamo malospingaz cioni.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: adu mahtu maluspingaz malavi kudi hanup?
ado mahto malospingaz malavi kodi hanop?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: nitu mahtu malavi, ni amin maluspingaz mahtu hanup.
nito mahto malavi, ni amin malospingaz mahto hanop.
S.TRANSL: 不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Ciang ukin lumah cin davus, kudipa mabaliv biciu.
Ciang okin lomah cin davos, kodipa mabaliv bicio.
S.TRANSL: Ciang，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Ciang, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: aizang ilumah cia tu tastupan i, kakang iahai mabaliv!
aizang ilomah cia to tastopan i, kakang iahai mabaliv!
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: kauman mais tasa, muhnang mabaliv tu dusa tu pan.
kaoman mais tasa, mohnang mabaliv to dosa to pan.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: na mabalivik biciu, aiza mu isbabaliv ha?
na mabalivik bicio, aiza mo isbabaliv ha?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: aiza! napia tu pan balivun su?
aiza! napia to pan balivon so?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: na mabalivik tu dusa tu pan mas biciu nasizang mas cilas tu tastu iahlup.
na mabalivik to dosa to pan mas bicio nasizang mas cilas to tasto iahlop.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.
米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?
I want some eggs too, do you have some?
I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: na mabalivik maputul pakiaman tu ulus.
na mabalivik mapotol pakiaman to olos.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.
We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: saivik tu tasa mas masanglav tu ulus.
saivik to tasa mas masanglav to olos.
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Ciang saiisa kasu sangan? adu saidipas undu?
Ciang saiisa kaso sangan? ado saidipas ondo?
S.TRANSL: Ciang你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
Ciang, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: ni, saidipik mindangaz hudaspingaz tansus sanglav.
ni, saidipik mindangaz hodaspingaz tansos sanglav.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: maupacia hangasia, adu aizanas sanavas zikang muskun ta maus haising.
maopacia hangasia, ado aizanas sanavas zikang moskon ta maos haising.
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: nitu mahtu i, na kudipik mabaliv ulus.
nito mahto i, na kodipik mabaliv olos.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: mihunisang, pia tu sui a sanglavan?
mihonisang, pia to soi a sanglavan?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: andi sanglavan tastu linuhus hai mapusan tu sui.
andi sanglavan tasto linohos hai maposan to soi.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?
Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: saivik sanglav tu dusa tu linuhus mas tastu cingcing tu utan.
saivik sanglav to dosa to linohos mas tasto cingcing to otan.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Ciang sipungulik madas ispapatas? adu mahtuas mapasimulku.
Ciang sipongolik madas ispapatas? ado mahtoas mapasimolko.
S.TRANSL: Ciang，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Ciang, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: ukanik amin, sain hai itu Puni cia.
okanik amin, sain hai ito Poni cia.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is Puni’s.

S.FORM: adu mahtu simulunku tu muiav? na maaipi saikin masuhis.
ado mahto simolonko to moiav? na maaipi saikin masohis.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: uninang, kadangzavik tahus Puni tu uninang.
oninang, kadangzavik tahos Poni to oninang.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank Puni for me.

S.FORM: na masuhisik mai-dusa tu ahil tan.
na masohisik mai-dosa to ahil tan.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: na simulangik ahil tan tu mai-tau.
na simolangik ahil tan to mai-tao.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: ung. suhaisav mais tal-ciunin, katu sipungul hai.
ong. sohaisav mais tal-cionin, kato sipongol hai.
S.TRANSL: 好了。記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: niangas maisuhis mas inak tu ishahaishais hai.
niangas maisohis mas inak to ishahaishais hai.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: amus nauka saduanku a ishahaishais tu.
amos naoka sadoanko a ishahaishais to.
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: adu ispasimul su mas Husung cia hai.
ado ispasimol so mas Hosong cia hai.
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to Husung?
I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: tangusun kuas mapasimul inak tu ishahaishais tan.
tangoson koas mapasimol inak to ishahaishais tan.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Puni, paisimulanas Husung cias pakaapavun tu ulustan aupa?
Poni, paisimolanas Hosong cias pakaapavon to olostan aopa?
S.TRANSL: Puni, did Husung lend you this coat?

S.FORM: ni, iscina sain tu sinbaliv masaivku.
ni, iscina sain to sinbaliv masaivko.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: mamaszang isu pakaapavunas itu Husung cia.
mamaszang iso pakaapavonas ito Hosong cia.
S.TRANSL: Husung’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: isaicia pakaapavun hai matahdung, ni inam patas mamaszang.
isaicia pakaapavon hai matahdong, ni inam patas mamaszang.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Puni, adu sinimulas sui sia Husung cia?
Poni, ado sinimolas soi sia Hosong cia?
S.TRANSL: Puni, did you borrow money from Husung?

S.FORM: aiza, ana suhaisunku hanian, kazasia sipungul saikin madas sui.
aiza, ana sohaisonko hanian, kazasia sipongol saikin madas soi.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: ungat, nakadangazun kuas tahus Husung cia.
ongat, nakadangazon koas tahos Hosong cia.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Husung for you.

S.FORM: aluaz hai kunias batu malhatub, cikulas hai kunias dun mal-ahu mais nasiza, maupacia mamantuk tu hansiap.
aloaz hai konias bato malhatob, cikolas hai konias don mal-aho mais nasiza, maopacia mamantok to hansiap.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: maupacia hangsia, kalivanku hangsia amu hangsia nik udadamuan.
maopacia hangsia, kalivanko hangsia amo hangsia nik odadamoan.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: ungat, naisnavan kuas mas ispalhahatub anis ispal-a-ahu mai-dusa tu hainiiapan.
ongat, naisnavan koas mas ispalhahatob anis ispal-a-aho mai-dosa to hainiiapan.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: uningdaingazang! mais maupacia hai na udadamuaninik mas minihumis matunu maun.
oningdaingazang! mais maopacia hai na odadamoaninik mas minihomis matono maon.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: madadaingin ismtu sia bangkal, kudipa sia suku cia izas navu, nakusianta bangkal cia.
madadaingin ismto sia bangkal, kodipa sia soko cia izas navo, nakosianta bangkal cia.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: isia ikin tu sisila cia, mais kungadahinas suku cia hai na usaduaninas.
isia ikin to sisila cia, mais kongadahinas soko cia hai na osadoaninas.
S.TRANSL: 在圓簍穀物乾燥簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: mananulua i, manushita navu a katu cidamusan.
mananoloa i, manoshita navo a kato cidamosan.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: katu kanliva kandapas inak tu sinpal-ahu cia.
kato kanliva kandapas inak to sinpal-aho cia.
mansia lukis tu tanngadah cia inak ahu.
mansia lokis to tanngadah cia inak aho.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: atunau i painhalanku at, haiiapangik tu manisa inak ahu a.
atonao i painhalanko at, haiiapangik to manisa inak aho a.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: saluzu sian, isdadamus iskaan sia vahlas.
salozo sian, isdadamos iskaan sia vahlas.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚荃，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: ukan kaimis saluzu, makuuni kaimis palaskan sizas iskan.
okan kaimis salozo, makooni kaimis palaskan sizas iskan.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: niang saikin maikusias palaskan sizas iskan, adu mahtu maisin isnavanik.
niang saikin maikosias palaskan sizas iskan, ado mahto maisin isnavanik.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: ungat! taskun ta maisin kudip malaskan.
ongat! taskon ta maisin kodip malaskan.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.
I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: kasuav siapav palaskana, adu sikakanis iskan i! vuvuhvuhin a isu palaskana.
kasoav siapav palaskana, ado sikakanis iskan i! vovohvohin a iso palaskana.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: mal-nauang i, masmuav a hatuan tu cinhadinghaiding, nasibutbutunangku palaskanan, kudipa kasu siza mas ami cia.
mal-naoang i, masmoav a hatoan to cinhadinghaiding, nasibotbotonangko palaskanan, kodipa kaso siza mas ami cia.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: pai-aupav zakuan cin iskanan, nakadangazan kuas sibutbut.
pai-aopav zakoan cin iskanan, nakadangazan koas sibotbot.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊。我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: masial aip tu hanian taisah i, laaminas iskaan lapaunghul a kalalaan.
masial aip to hanian taisah i, laaminas iskaan lapaonghol a kalalaan.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: mabiskavta kulumah i, na ispahusiltas taisan a iskanan.
mabiskavta kolomah i, na ispahosiltas taisan a iskanan.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: kakaa'in tu lalu, mabiskava mal'anuhu sian alnunuhuan.
kakaa'in to lalo, mabiskava mal'anoho sian alnonohoan.
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: asi'ima a aip, islunghu mais kutun, taskuna mapahainan!
asi'ima a aip, islongho mais koton, taskona mapahainan!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!
Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: asitau mais kutunin, kaudiip a kata kutunin pismali!
asitao mais kotonin, kaodiip a kata kotonin pismali!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: namapikua a kasu mais kutun tu cinmut i?
namapikoa a kaso mais koton to cinmot i?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: mais kutunin hai niciu, nataskun a saikin mas cina, kausian kiukai.
mais kotonin hai nicio, nataskon a saikin mas cina, kaosian kiokai.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.
I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: masnanava! madahpa a inaak cian, namuunata a saikin.
masnanava! madahpa a inaak cian, namoonata a saikin.
S.TRANSL: 老師!我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: adu mahtu a saikin kaudiip tal'ima i?
ado mahto a saikin kaodiip tal'ima i?
S.TRANSL: May I go wash my hands?
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: masnanava! madahpa a inaak bungu, na'islunghu hanian.
masnanava! madahpa a inaak bongo, na'islongho hanian.
S.TRANSL: 老師!我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: masnanava! na'isluhu a saikin mais muhna'in tu asitasa, nakaudiip a saikin mapa'iu.
masnanava! na'isloho a saikin mais mohna'in to asitasa, nakaodiip a saikin mapa'io.
S.TRANSL: 老師!我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: madahpa a isaicia cian, isian unataan a saia.
madahpa a isaicia cian, isian onataan a saia.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: masnanava, madahpa a ituDahu buthul, islunghu aip.
masnanava, madahpa a itoDaho bothol, islongho aip.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Dahu has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: tupaun a saikin tu Bukun, aiza'in laupaku tu mas'an hamisan.
topaon a saikin to Bokon, aiza'in laopako to mas'an hamisan.
S.TRANSL: My name is Bukun, and I’m 10 years old.

S.FORM: itumaaz tu siduh a kasu tu uvaaz i?
itomaaz to sidoh a kaso to ovaaz i?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: adu Incumin amin a isuu tastulumah i?
ado Incomin amin a isoo tastolomah i?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: uung, Bunun amin a kaimin tastulumah.
oong, Bonon amin a kaimin tastolomah.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是布農族人。
Yes, my whole family is Bunun.

S.FORM: adu Incumin amin a isuu tastulumah i?
ado Incomin amin a isoo tastolomah i?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: nii, maza inaak tama hai Bunun, maza inaak cina hai Ngaingai.
nii, maza inaak tama hai Bonon, maza inaak cina hai Ngaingai.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是布農族，我的媽媽是客家人。
No, my father is Bunun, and my mother is Hakka.

S.FORM: isima a kasu tu uvaaz i?
isima a kaso to ovaaz i?
adu isuu a adiipa tu tama i? pia'in a isaicia hamisan?
ado isoo a adiipa to tama i? pia'in a isaicia hamisan?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: aiza'in a saia tu manuumun hamisan.
aiza'in a saia to manoomon hamisan.
adu isuu adiipa tu tama i? pia'in a isaicia hamisan?
ado isoo adiipa to tama i? pia'in a isaicia hamisan?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: nii, maza saia hai inaam tu asang tu madadaingaz, mavau'unin a saia tu hamisan.
nii, maza saia hai inaam to asang to madadaingaz, mavao'onin a saia to hamisan.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: pia tu hamisan a isuu tuhasnanaz i?
pia to hamisan a isoo tohasnanaz i?
mas'anhanvau'in tu hamisan a inaak tuhasnanaz.
mas'anhanvao'in to hamisan a inaak tohasnanaz.
adu mapahaisdaingaz a isaicia hamisan mas suu i?
ado mapahaisdaingaz a isaicia hamisan mas soo i?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: mapahais a kaimin tu ima hamisan.
mapahais a kaimin to ima hamisan.
tasasaba tu masipatun tu miciu a saikin.
tasasaba to masipaton to micio a saikin.
malbuntuin nii tu mapasadu, adu tallaungkavin a kasu i?
malbontoin nii to mapasado, ado tallaongkavin a kaso i?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: uung, tasasaba maciun tu miciu a saikin.
oong, tasasaba macion to micio a saikin.
uung, maciunin tu kungking a saikin.
oong, macionin to kongking a saikin.
nakausian papatasan a saikin, kilim mas masnanava.
nakaosian papatasan a saikin, kilim mas masnanava.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.

S.FORM: nakaudiipa a saia mavail mas vinail.
nakaodiipa a saia mavail mas vinail.
S.TRANSL: He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: isian sunghahaulan a saia, aupa namapasavai a saia mais sanganin.
isian songhahaolan a saia, aopa namapasavai a saia mais sanganin.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: isa a Humhum i? namapasavai a saia cisdadaan mais sanganin.
isa a Homhom i? namapasavai a saia cisdadaan mais sanganin.
S.TRANSL: Humhum在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Humhum? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: isian u'a'ampukan a saia, kaudiipik munanau mas saicia.
isian o'a'ampokan a saia, kaodiipik monanao mas saicia.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: natangusang a saikin mabaliv mas pinittaunghuvali, nakilimunku a kasu mais sanganin.
natangosang a saikin mabaliv mas pinittaonghovali, nakilimonko a kaso mais sanganin.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.
Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: kilima mas duma tu bunun, aupa nakaudiipik kilim mas masnanava.
kilima mas doma to bonon, aopa nakaodiipik kilim mas masnanava.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: adu namapasavai a Natuh aip mas tuhtuhmali i?
ado namapasavai a Natoh aip mas tohtohmali i?
S.TRANSL: Is Natuh competing in croquet today?

S.FORM: nii, namapasavai a saia mas macilauskav.
nii, namapasavai a saia mas macilaoskav.
S.TRANSL: No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: adu namin'amu a kasu mapasavai mais pantataip tu hanian i?
ado namin'amo a kaso mapasavai mais pantataip to hanian i?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: uung, namapasavai a saikin mas mapasinap.
oong, namapasavai a saikin mas mapasinap.
adu namin'amu a kasu mapasavai mais pantataipin tu hanian i?
ado namin'amo a kaso mapasavai mais pantataipin to hanian i?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: namapikua a kata mais pantataip tu hanian i?
namapikoa a kata mais pantataip to hanian i?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: adu namapabaliv a kata mas kakaunun mais pantataipin i?
ado namapabaliv a kata mas kakaonon mais pantataipin i?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: nii, namapabaliv a kata mas i'ipun.
nii, namapabaliv a kata mas i'ipon.
ua! atalu a kasu mas sauluktasa masmuav tu mamananu!
oa! atalo a kaso mas saoloktasa masmoav to mamanano!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶！真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!
Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: uka, laupang a saia kaunata nasanavanin minsuma
oka, laopang a saia kaonata nasanavanin minsoma
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: isian a saia dusalautu, kaudadazaa kilim mas saicia.
isian a saia dosalaoto, kaodadazaa kilim mas saicia.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: adu aiza a bunun ilumah i?
ado aiza a bonon ilomah i?
Banitul hangsia, malbuntu'in nii tu mapasadu mas suu, malsialsialangas aupa i?
Banitol hangsia, malbonto'in nii to mapasado mas soo, malsialsialangas aopa i?
S.TRANSL: 是Banitul阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s Banitul. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?
I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: isian pipit'ia'an a saia makaling mas pandian, kaudiipik malala mas saicia.
isian pipit'ia'an a saia makaling mas pandian, kaodiipik malala mas saicia.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: kausian pattulkukan a saia madamu mas tulkuk
kaosian pattolkokan a saia madamo mas tolkok
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: uka ilumah a imuu hudasnanaz, isian huma a saia, ilumaha a kamu maltatala mas saicia
oka ilomah a imoo hodasnanaz, isian homa a saia, ilomaha a kamo maltatala mas saicia
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: malbuntu'in nii tu mapasadu, tallauskavin a kasu
malbonto'in nii to mapasado, tallaoskavin a kaso
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.
It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: maza sain hai paimuu tu bunglai, pusianav piskakazavan
maza sain hai paimoo to bonglai, posianav piskakazavan
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: malbuntu'in nii tu minsuma, taudanivunku amin tu muskuna maun mas haising
malbonto'in nii to minsoma, taodanivonko amin to moskona maon mas haising
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: masu, nakaaz a saikin huud mas savil, kausianta bukzavan mahalinga
maso, nakaaz a saikin hood mas savil, kaosianta bokzavan mahalinga
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: uninang mas isuu tu sinpulaung namusuhisin a saikin
oninang mas isoo to sinpolaong namosohisin a saikin
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: laupang a andiip tulkukan patazun, adasavsu ikdaukdauk
laopang a andiip tolkokan patazon, adasavso ikdaokdaok
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: mahtuik aupa mapatu'ampuk mas suu sian kutun tu minaunin i?
mahtoik aopa mapato'ampok mas soo sian koton to minaonin i?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: mahtuta aupa mapatu'ampuk sian pasnanavaan i? nakahaningu a kata
mahtota aopa mapato'ampok sian pasnanavaan i? nakahaningo a kata
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.
那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: maza isian inaam tu asang a dandan mais kalipuah hai manauazdaingaz. minsumaa kilimku mais kalipuahin
maza isian inaam to asang a dandan mais kalipoah hai manaoazdaingaz. minsomaa kilimko mais kalipoahin
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: na'asa tu maltatala sausian namintalabal. alasanin aupa i!
na'asa to maltatala saosian namintalabal. alasanin aopa i!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?
那你進倉祭的時候來吧!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: mavia a kasu tu nakausian asang mainhumis i?
mavia a kaso to nakaosian asang mainhomis i?
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: mavia tu nii tu isian hici masnava i?
mavia to nii to isian hici masnava i?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: aupa mililiskinik mas inaak tu asang, hadang amin mahtu masaumbaas mas asang
aopa mililiskinik mas inaak to asang, hadang amin mahto masaombaas mas asang
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: mahansiapas macindun, tu? sima a maisnavasu i?
mahansiapas macindon, to? sima a maisnavaso i?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: inaak tu hudaspingaz, maza saia hai isian inaam tu asang mastaan mahansiap macindun tu bunun
inaak to hodaspingaz, maza saia hai isian inaam to asang mastaan mahansiap macindon to bonon
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: mavia a kasu tu na'asa mapasnava mas macindun i?
mavia a kaso to na'asa mapasnava mas macindon i?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: maza macindunan hai inaam tu sin'inhumis, asa'ik mapal'aiza mas sin'inhumisatan
maza macindonan hai inaam to sin'inhomis, asa'ik mapal'aiza mas sin'inhomisatan
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: tuzatuza tu mamananuas, adu malbuntu a sain ka'unian i?
tozatoza to mamananoas, ado malbonto a sain ka'onian i?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: nii, na'aiza tu tastu'islunghuan, tangusun a dulaz siin paaz ma'aliv, aat ibulan mas tamul mahaivhaiv, ungat mahtuin pungadahun sian amunu
nii, na'aiza to tasto'islonghoan, tangoson a dolaz siin paaz ma'aliv, aat ibolan mas tamol mahaivhaiv, ongat mahtoin pongadahon sian amono
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: aiza izakuantan mahav siin cilkung, kai'anak'anakunku amin masuaz.
aiza izakoantan mahav siin cilkong, kai'anak'anakonko amin masoaz.
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: piatusui mais balivun amin dusa'an i?
piatosoi mais balivon amin dosa'an i?
pudinunun hai dusasaba tu maimaun tu sui.
podinonon hai dosasaba to maimaon to soi.
mazima'ik mas andiip tu ulustan, piatusui i?
mazima'ik mas andiip to olostan, piatosoi i?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: mahlisdaingaz, adu mahtu vanahun tu kauman i?
mahlisdaingaz, ado mahto vanahon to kaoman i?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: nii tu mahtu, naminhanglasik mais vanahun.
nii to mahto, naminhanglasik mais vanahon.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: uung iahai! siza'ik mas matahdung tu ulustan.
oong iahai! siza'ik mas matahdong to olostan.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.
我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: pudinunun hai mapus'ansaba tu sui, kai'anak'anakunku a sain ka'uni, mahtu malbuntu iskusia.
podinonon hai mapos'ansaba to soi, kai'anak'anakonko a sain ka'oni, mahto malbonto iskosia.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: mais mapishaiapik mas kaviaz tu kausianacin mabaliv hai adu mahtu iasui tu kauman i?
mais mapishaiapik mas kaviaz to kaosianacin mabaliv hai ado mahto iasoi to kaoman i?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: mahtu! nakadazun siza tu pininmas'an tu vau.
mahto! nakadazon siza to pininmas'an to vao.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: sadua! aiza amin a ulus siin tamuung isbabaliv.
sadoa! aiza amin a olos siin tamoong isbabaliv.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: mais tasa ulus hai tausaba tu maimaun tu sui. aat tau hai mas'ansaba.
mais tasa olos hai taosaba to maimaon to soi. aat tao hai mas'ansaba.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: mabalivik iahai tu tasa, isizaavik mas bahlu.
mabalivik iahai to tasa, isizaavik mas bahlo.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: mihumisang, namabalivik mas tangusul siin ininmahavan tu cici.
mihomisang, namabalivik mas tangosol siin ininmahavan to cici.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: ispaku'aminin a haising, aizaanangik mas buhultana, adu namabalivas i?
ispako'aminin a haising, aizaanangik mas boholtana, ado namabalivas i?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: uung iahai! saivavik tu tasa, namabalivik haising mais muhna'in.
oong iahai! saivavik to tasa, namabalivik haising mais mohna'in.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: uung, kankanunku sian iahluup, maimaun tu sui iskaupacia.
oong, kankanonko sian iahloop, maimaon to soi iskaopacia.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
